name: manipulable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
mainly disapproving easily controlled to your advantage, often unfairly or dishonestly: Teenagers mostly thought that fathers were considerably less manipulable than mothers. He saw in the new president an easily manipulable person.
able to be controlled using the hands: The game consists of manipulable images generated by a video game console. We want texts to be easily searchable and manipulable.
More examplesFewer examplesThe public are deliberately kept ignorant by politicians to make them more easily manipulable.It's a system that's very politically manipulable.
